arm_group.description: When ready Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (NCPAP) will be removed from the neonate
NCPAP will be removed by gradually decreasing pressure over 24 hours once the weaning is decided

brief_summary.textblock:
To compare the 2 methods of weaning of nasal continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) in
      premature babies born between 26 and 32 weeks

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing Weaning of Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (CPAP) From Preterm Infants

detailed_description.textblock:
To study the weight and the post menstrual age (PMA) at the time of NCPAP  wean utilizing
      the method of sudden wean as compared to gradual wean.

      Methods: A prospective randomized trial was conducted comparing sudden weaning with gradual
      weaning from NCPAP in neonates with gestational age between  26  and 32 weeks. The patients
      were randomized to one of the two methods of weaning from NCPAP and their success was
      compared

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All neonates born 26 to 32 weeks of gestational age

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Those  with severe congenital anomalies and chromosomal defects including congenital
             heart disease, neurological malformations, chest and airway abnormalities and lung
             hypoplasia

intervention.description: NCPAP will be removed by gradually decreasing pressure over 24 hours once the weaning is decided

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Control Trial of Weaning NCPAP From Preterm Infants: Sudden Wean Versus Weaning by Gradually Decreasing Pressure

other_outcome.measure: length of stay in the neonatal intensive care unit
other_outcome.time_frame: when ready to be discharged, expected average of 6-8 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Weight and corrected gestational age (GA) when neonates could come off NCPAP
primary_outcome.time_frame: Completion of Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure (NCPAP) treatment, expected average of 4 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight and corrected GA when come off oxygen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: when off supplemental oxygen expected average of 2 weeks

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
